title: 112_s1484
content: The Act titled "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions and provides conscience protections by amending Title 1 of the United States Code to include a new chapter on these issues. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits federal funding for abortions and health benefits plans that cover abortion. It also includes provisions on limitations for federal facilities and employees, use of non-Federal funds for health coverage, and treatment of abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits federal funding for abortions and health benefits plans that cover abortion. It also includes provisions on limitations for federal facilities and employees regarding abortion services. Individuals, entities, or states can purchase separate abortion coverage using non-Federal funds as long as no federally appropriated funds are used. Sec. 305 allows non-Federal health benefits coverage providers to offer abortion coverage using non-Federal funds, as long as no matching funds from federally subsidized programs are used. Sec. 306 ensures that this chapter does not affect other Federal laws limiting funds for abortion. Sec. 307 clarifies that the chapter does not apply to the treatment of complications arising from abortion. The rule allows for the treatment of infections, injuries, diseases, or disorders resulting from an abortion, regardless of its legality or funding source. Exceptions are made for abortions in cases of rape, incest, or when the mother's life is at risk. The chapter also applies to funds appropriated by Federal law in the District of Columbia. The term 'Federal Government' includes the government of the District of Columbia. No government discrimination against certain health care entities is allowed, including individual physicians, hospitals, and health insurance plans, regarding abortion services. The courts have jurisdiction to prevent violations of discrimination against health care entities regarding abortion services. Legal or equitable relief, including injunctions and orders, can be issued to stop such conduct. Actions can be initiated by health care entities or the Attorney General of the United States. The Secretary of Health and Human Services administers this section. The Secretary of Health and Human Services designates the Director of the Office for Civil Rights to receive and investigate complaints of violations related to discrimination against health care entities. The Director can coordinate with the Attorney General and refer complaints to other agencies if necessary. Prohibiting taxpayer funded abortions and providing conscience protections.
